definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: And don't know where it is melted, or twinkling rising moon.
sentences.chinese: 乃至分不清它到底是熔日，亦或荧荧初升的皓月了。

sentences.english: When the night comes, attesting the busy city of lights.
sentences.chinese: 当黑夜来临，华灯初升的繁华都市。

sentences.english: Across the surface of the river was splashed the flaming gold of the sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 江面之上布满了初升的太阳的熔金之色。

sentences.english: The rising sun is orient in the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 在蓝天里初升太阳光辉夺目。

sentences.english: All my life the early sun has hurt my eyes, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 我这一辈子，初升的太阳老是刺痛我的眼睛，他想。

sentences.english: To tempt a first star to a tremor.
sentences.chinese: 诱引一颗初升的星化为一个震颤。

sentences.english: The sun shone on the gold of her hair.
sentences.chinese: 江面之上布满了初升的太阳的熔金之色。

sentences.english: The rising sun danced in water like molten gold .
sentences.chinese: 初升的太阳犹如熔化的金子在水中荡漾。

sentences.english: The rising sun jumped into the sky from the horizon, where the sea joins the sky.
sentences.chinese: 初升的朝阳从海天相接的水平线上跃上了天空。

sentences.english: It will roar down the track with the rising of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 它将与初升的太阳一起带我们进入新的一天。

sentences.english: The rising sun is shining with boundless radiance and holding the Huasheng people's pioneering ideal.
sentences.chinese: 初升的太阳喷涌着万丈光芒，托起华升人创业的理想。

definition: multicolored sunlight of sunrise or sunset
first rays of morning sun/first glimmer of dawn
variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
the sun sets in the west (idiom)
to be exposed to the sun/in a position facing the sun

Chaoyang district in east and northeast Beijing, a county level district of Beijing municipality/Chaoyang prefecture-level city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China/Chaoyang district of Changchun city 長春市|长春市, Jilin/Chaoyang county in Chaoyang 朝陽|朝阳[Chao2 yang2], Liaoning
to shine brightly/(fig.) to perceive clearly
